description: A simple command-line todo application that demonstrates MAT workflow validation

userStories.title: Initialize todo storage
userStories.description: As a user, I want my todos stored in a JSON file so that they persist between sessions.
acceptanceCriteria: Handle missing file gracefully (create empty list)

userStories.title: Add new todo item
userStories.description: As a user, I want to add new todo items so that I can track what I need to do.
acceptanceCriteria: `add_todo(title)` adds new todo with unique ID
New todos have title, created timestamp, completed=False

userStories.title: List all todos
userStories.description: As a user, I want to see all my todos so that I know what tasks are pending.
acceptanceCriteria: Return empty list if no todos exist

userStories.title: Mark todo as complete
userStories.description: As a user, I want to mark todos as complete so that I can track my progress.
acceptanceCriteria: Set completed timestamp when marking complete
Return error if todo ID not found

userStories.title: Delete todo item
userStories.description: As a user, I want to delete todos so that I can remove items I no longer need.
acceptanceCriteria: Return error if todo ID not found

userStories.title: Create CLI interface
userStories.description: As a user, I want a command-line interface so that I can interact with my todos easily.
